summary: Yet after a while the motion of her horse became as soothing as the rocking of a cradle, and Arya found her eyes growing heavy....
text:
Yet after a while the motion of her horse became as soothing as the rocking of a cradle, and Arya found her eyes growing heavy. She let them close, just for an instant, then snapped them wide again. I can’t go to sleep, she screamed at herself silently, I can’t, I can’t. She knuckled at her eye and rubbed it hard to keep it open, clutching the reins tightly and kicking her mount to a canter. But neither she nor the horse could sustain the pace, and it was only a few moments before they fell back to a walk again, and a few more until her eyes closed a second time. This time they did not open quite so quickly.
When they did, she found that her horse had come to a stop and was nibbling at a tuft of grass, while Gendry was shaking her arm. “You fell asleep,” he told her.
“I was just resting my eyes.”
“You were resting them a long while, then. Your horse was wandering in a circle, but it wasn’t till she stopped that I realized you were sleeping. Hot Pie’s just as bad, he rode into a tree limb and got knocked off, you should have heard him yell. Even that didn’t wake you up. You need to stop and sleep.”
“I can keep going as long as you can.” She yawned. “Liar,” he said. “You keep going if you want to be stupid, but I’m stopping. I’ll take the first watch. You sleep.” “What about Hot Pie?” Gendry pointed. Hot Pie was already on the ground, curled up beneath his cloak on a bed of damp leaves and snoring softly. He had a big wedge of cheese in one fist, but it looked as though he had fallen asleep between bites. It was no good arguing, Arya realized; Gendry had the right of it. The Mummers will need to sleep too, she told herself, hoping it was true. She was so weary it was a struggle even to get down from the saddle, but she remembered to hobble her horse before finding a place beneath a beech tree. The ground was hard and damp. She wondered how long it would be before she slept in a bed again, with hot food and a fire to warm her.

Gendry: *holding a sign that says “Homecoming?” outside of Winterfell*
Jon: Oh my god! Yes!
Gendry: No, tell Arya!
Jon:...
body:
Gendry: *holding a sign that says “Homecoming?” outside of Winterfell*

Jon: Oh my god! Yes!

Gendry: No, tell Arya!

Jon: *yelling* ARYA! IM GOING TO HOMECOMING WITH YOUR BOYFRIEND!

tags: and she would kill two more before she was through
summary: It wasn’t Harren, Arya wanted to say, it was me. She had killed Chiswyck with a whisper, and she would kill two more before she...
text: It wasn’t Harren, Arya wanted to say, it was me. She had killed Chiswyck with a whisper, and she would kill two more before she was through. I’m the ghost in Harrenhal, she thought. And that night, there was one less name to hate.

summary: Opinion: The demonisation of Sansa and her friends Jeyne and Beth is awful, they where little girls not the fictional...
question: Opinion: The demonisation of Sansa and her friends Jeyne and Beth is awful, they where little girls not the fictional personification of the mean girls at school. Also Sansa never bullied Arya, they where both mean to eachother, Sansa called Arya horseface and Arya called Sansa and her interest stupid, it was a mutual name calling of both of the Stark sisters.
answer:
I’m not sure if this is a troll ask or not because in the past I’ve talked in length about the bullying of Arya and the effects it had on her soul. In any case since it seems that some parts of the fandom need a reminder let me say this: Sansa and her friends did bullied Arya.

You are claiming that Sansa and Arya were just mean to each other and yet the example you are citing is unaccurate. Arya never called Sansa stupid. The closest to this is Arya calling the Hand’s tourney “stupid” while expressing her displeasure of going on that event. How does that compare to Sansa and her friends constantly calling Arya “horseface” to the point that even Theon Greyjoy - a person who wasn’t close to the youngest Starks- knew that nickname? It simply doesn’t compare and it’s obvious which one is a case of bullying.

I’m not claiming that Arya is the perfect sibling who can do no wrong because she’s also capable of being mean throwing an insult or an orange to her sister. But unlike Sansa (and her friends) Arya never called them a hurtful nickname that lowered their self esteem like they did to her.

Also, I don’t know what your image of mean girls at school is but for me Sansa and her friends fit to that trope regarding how they treated Arya Little girls can be mean girls at school, bulling knows no age. In this fictional case it was actually worse because mean girls at school stay at school, while Arya’s bullers were inside her home. 

Finally, I haven’t seen anyone who admits that Sansa and her friends bullied Arya to actually demonize them. Unless you count admiting facts as “demonisation”.Most people who admit that Arya was bullied by Sansa and her friends, don’t hate those kids and neither wish anything bad to happened to them. In fact they are horrified by Jeyne’s rape and the abuse Sansa had to go through. You see it’s possible to sympathize with a character and also admit their bad traits/old habits.

summary: 🐺Arya Stark appreciation 41/-  The Many-Faced God will take your ears, your nose, your tongue. He will take your sad grey eyes...
caption:
🐺Arya Stark appreciation 41/-

The Many-Faced God will take your ears, your nose, your tongue. He will take your sad grey eyes that have seen so much. He will take your hands, your feet, your arms and legs, your private parts. He will take your hopes and dreams, your loves and hates. Those who enter His service must give up all that makes them who they are. Can you do that?

I have a hole where my heart should be, she thought, and nowhere else to go.

summary: Regarding Emila’s interview... Y’all really think that Dany is Jon’s most important relationship ? They know each other for...
body:
Regarding Emila’s interview… Y’all really think that Dany is Jon’s most important relationship ? They know each other for what… one month at most ? 

I think Emilia could be talking from Dany’s point of view. After all, she’s in love with him and she’s used to have every man at her feet. She could think Jon would do anything for her, just like the others did.

But Jon has a family. Shipping aside, I don’t think anyone could best Jon and Arya relationship. After all, she’s his sister (not by blood, but he loves her the same). Arya would always be Jon’s most important relationship, over Dany.

Also, it’s funny that Kit said the opposite (I know he could be biased by his beautiful wife, but still… I find this very telling):

“I think Jon’s never been happier than when he was with [Ygritte] — and I don’t think he ever will be “ Source

blog.name: outoftunemelody
blog.title: Fiction consumes me and reality is a distant dream

summary: Lady Crane died too soon. D&D had the chance to merge her character with Lady Smallwood's and introduce her a bit earlier in...
body:
Lady Crane died too soon. D&D had the chance to merge her character with Lady Smallwood’s and introduce her a bit earlier in season 5 for Arya’s storyline. Although I guess more screen time couldnt be sacrificed and that “Bad Pussy” scene was essential.

It’s a pity to see the under-used talent of Essie Davis and the lack in further development of Arya’s and Lady Crane’s relationship. Just think about it though.

Arya sees Lady Crane as a mother figure and is reminded of her family back in Westeros. Arya’s choice to become a cold, unfeeling assassin or Arya Stark of Winterfell becomes much harder. This conflict becomes more prevalent in Arya.

I guess we have to settle on 2 little conversations between Arya and Crane, and the questionable stabbing scene where Arya has super healing and there’s no real consequences. Lady Crane’s role and death could have been more impactful on Arya if she was set up and developed earlier. Arya seeing the ugly side of the Faceless Men and Arya rejecting the Faceless Men could have been a more powerful scene.

For now, we’ll have to deal with Arya being the distant, cold executioner of House Stark (despite Arya rejecting that path when she walked out of the House of Black and White) alongside her brother, cold and distant interface, Bran Version 2.003.01 of House Stark.

However, Maisie mentioning that the next season will be more light-hearted for Arya and she’ll have different goals is giving me hope.

Lady Crane died too soon. D&D had the chance to merge her character with Lady Smallwood’s and introduce her a bit earlier in season 5 for Arya’s storyline. Although I guess more screen time couldnt be sacrificed and that “Bad Pussy” scene was essential.

It’s a pity to see the under-used talent of Essie Davis and the lack in further development of Arya’s and Lady Crane’s relationship. Just think about it though.

Arya sees Lady Crane as a mother figure and is reminded of her family back in Westeros. Arya’s choice to become a cold, unfeeling assassin or Arya Stark of Winterfell becomes much harder. This conflict becomes more prevalent in Arya.

I guess we have to settle on 2 little conversations between Arya and Crane, and the questionable stabbing scene where Arya has super healing and there’s no real consequences. Lady Crane’s role and death could have been more impactful on Arya if she was set up and developed earlier. Arya seeing the ugly side of the Faceless Men and Arya rejecting the Faceless Men could have been a more powerful scene.

For now, we’ll have to deal with Arya being the distant, cold executioner of House Stark (despite Arya rejecting that path when she walked out of the House of Black and White) alongside her brother, cold and distant interface, Bran Version 2.003.01 of House Stark.

However, Maisie mentioning that the next season will be more light-hearted for Arya and she’ll have different goals is giving me hope.

summary: Sansa And Arya As A Quote From My French Class
title: Sansa And Arya As A Quote From My French Class
body:
Sansa: What did the French consumer say when he was frustrated?
Arya: What?
Sansa, deadpan: Achète
Arya, hysterically laughing: That's so s t u p i d
